TopicTitle: Uncharted Past: A Brief History of Kerbin in Uncharted Lands

Articles.Content:
Uncharted Lands is a planet pack for Kopernicus plugin, created by KillAshley, that remakes the Kerbol Solar System. It uses no heightmaps or color maps that are not procedurally generated with KSP's own procedural PQS system. It's quite cool.

 

What follows is a brief history of Kerbin in the uncharted lands universe.

 

A very very long time ago, about one thousand years before the Kerbal Space Program was founded, a woman named Bohr was walking along the beaches of what is now northern Alaitsua. She had a very interesting idea regarding the blue-green rock that had very recently fallen out of the sky. She looked up at the rather wide ring arching across the southern sky. It too was blue-green, and more or less the exact same color. She told her friends about it, and one of them (named Chaffe the Explorer) mentioned the idea in his book of philosophy. The idea was this: Minmus, The Sky Arch, and the mineral known as Chondritum are all made from the same materials. No one had any proof of this, but the idea made a sort of logical sense, so the readers of the book rather liked the idea.

Only a few years later, many natural philosophers were captivated by the Sky Arch, ever since Chaffe The Explorer's "The Study of The Skies" made them realize that it could be a physical object. They performed experiments and discovered several fascinating conclusions about the nature of the Kerbin system. They were able to figure out that:

  1. Kerbin, Mun, and Dres are spherical.
  2. The distance between Kerbin, Minmus, Mun, and Dres.
  3. The fact that Kerbin orbits the Sun along with all of the planets.
  4. The relative brightness of stars.
  5. The distance to the stars.

These discoveries were made using only the naked Kerbal eye, and simple geometry.

 

Unfortunately, only 50 years after these discoveries were made, they were lost when anti-science barbarians burned down The Library of Kriman. Unfortunately, the burning down of The Library coincided with the fall of the Bealean empire, setting into course a 700 year long dark age.

 

About two hundred years before the first launch of the Kerbal Space Program, an astronomer pointed a new device at the sky. This device was built to look at distant ships, but could just as easily be used to look at the skies. This instrument was the Telescope. The inventor of the sky-telescope was named Zephram Kerman. Using the telescope, he produced detailed drawings on Minmus and Dres, and updated many of the low-detail maps of the Mun. He rediscovered the principles of astronomy, a series of books written about the sky arch. He made the first observation that the arch was very similar to a ring, and in his writings called the sky arch "Kerbin's Ring." His book was so amazing they named an entire sea after him.

About a hundred years before the skies roared with the sound of the first sounding rocket to be shot away from the ground at the Kerbal Space Center, during the age of steam, the spectrometer was invented. A rather simple invention really, you would expect it to be invented far earlier. Using this instrument it was possible to find out that, incredibly, The Rings, Minmus, and the mineral known as Chondritum were made from the same substance.

About 40, the civilized nations of the planet, North Bealeland, South Bealeland, The United States Of Alaitsua, the Boronto Provinces, and the Ussaric Union were getting quite mad at each other. They had all been stocking up one weapons, and it wasn't too long before a fight broke out. Once the war started, other countries got pulled into the war until much of the world was fighting this war.

The side known as The Good Guys was made up of the following nations:

  • The United States of Alaitsua
  • South Bealeland
  • South Peepo
  • Jungloid and Tundrunics National Territories
  • Cerimas
  • B*lg**m (sorry to moderators if that's trying to get around the curse list)
  • Vance
  • Vaine
  • The Conglomerate of the Monarchy

The side known as "Come On Guys, You had to take THAT NAMe?" or COGYTHATNAM was made up of the following nations:

  • Curpelsfractasodaless Union of Greater Ussarri
  • Ussarric Union
  • Verminy
  • Omork
  • Vaustria
  • West Boronto
  • Kazfin

The COGYTHATNAM very nearly won the war, but when The United States of Alaitsua finally joined the fight officially, The Good Guys won. A treaty was drawn which significantly redrew the maps. Boronto was unified, Bealeland and Peepo were split, The Ussaric Union and the Curepelsfractasodaless Union of Greater Usarri reluctantly decided to change the spelling of their "Ussarri", and Cerimas ceased being a monarchy. Not too long after the war, the nations of Kerbin almost universally decided that the whole thing was Verminy's fault and stopped trading with them. Verminy's economy began to fail. 20 years after the ceasefire of the first Kerbin War, the second Kerbin War began, with the same sides more or less. Verminy tried to take over Kerbin, and failed because the leader was not very charismatic and kept trying to kill everyone who worshiped Minmus. The end of the war began a new era of peaceful co-operation in the world. Except that the United States Of Alaitsua and the Curpelsfractasodaless Union of Greater Usarri were still made at each other. 10 years later, they were officially in a not-really-war called a "cold war" and the nations of Vallator united into the Vallaton Union.

During this cold war, a rocket scientist from the Verman military moved to Alaitsua and brought his rocket technology with him. His name was Wernher von Kerman, and he was very happy to stop dropping bombs on people with rockets and start shooting rockets into space. Unfortunately for him and his team, the Alaitsuan army recruited Wernher von Kerman for missile development against Greater Usarri.

After a few years of development, the Kerbal Space Program was founded to explore space using missile technology. Usarri and Alaitua were now in a space race. But that's another story. (which may or may not end up being told)
